Here's a brief explanation of how I arrived at the solution:

1. From statement 17, we know the owner of the chinchilla is on the far left. From statement 18, we know they're in an odd position, so they must be in position 1.
2. From statement 20, we know the polish is in an even position, so they must be in position 2 or 4. From statement 22, we know they're on the right of the nigerian, so they must be in position 4.
3. From statement 14, we know the owner of the dog is the nigerian. From statement 5, we know they're somewhere to the left of the owner of the frog. Since the polish is in position 4, the nigerian must be in position 3.
4. From statement 10, we know the person eating peas is on the right of the owner of the turtle. Since the turtle is in position 5, the person eating peas must be in position 4.
5. From statement 11, we know the british is somewhere to the right of the person eating zucchini. Since the zucchini-eater is in position 5, the british must be in position 5.
6. From statement 16, we know the british is not the owner of the frog. From statement 10, we know the owner of the frog is the person eating grapes. Since the british is in position 5, the person eating grapes must be in position 4.
7. From statement 15, we know the person eating pineapple and the nigerian have different parity positions. Since the nigerian is in position 3, the person eating pineapple must be in an even position. From statement 21, we know they're somewhere to the right of the japanese, so they must be in position 2.
8. From statement 13, we know the person who's hobby is collecting is on the left of the person who's hobby is writing. Since the collecting hobby is in position 1, the writing hobby must be in position 2.
9. From statement 10, we know the owner of the frog is the person who's hobby is sudoku. Since the sudoku hobby is in position 3, the frog must be in position 3.
10. From statement 19, we know the person who's hobby is magic-tricks is on the far right. Since the magic-tricks hobby is in position 5, the british must be the owner of the frog (since the frog is in position 3).

The rest of the puzzle falls into place from here.
